cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast across Florida’s Big Bend, then curving northeastward along the southeastern U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near the Suwannee River–Mexico Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC including Pamlico Sound (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL and west of Mexico Beach FL to Walton/Bay County line FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Big Bend) through coastal Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of 25–35 mph gusts possible in outer rain-bands; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat expected on the Mobile Bay shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of squally rain bands possible, locally higher in heavier cells
